answers.author: Roy Witherow
answers.text:
The Village of Lake Zurich, Illinois has used Norris Design to conduct an extensive analysis, survey, and trend analysis for the village's park system.  We have also engaged the Northern Illinois University Center for Government Studies for a more comprehensive analysis of village demographic trends.

Hi Robert, 
Here are two resources that should be helpful to you as you examine your own community. 
-The first is a previously asked question that has examples of best practices with dealing with population growth. http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/questions/kn/Question/22958/Best_practices_for_population_growth
-The second is a previously asked question about determining future staffing needs for local governments. Some of the suggestions and formulas should be helpful to you when not just looking at staffing needs but the community as a whole. http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/questions/question/22891
Best, 
Robin Saywitz 
ICMA Knowledge Network Intern
rsaywitz@icma.org

author: Robert Kiely
text:
Has your community or region engaged consultants to perform population projection studies? Looking for something more comprehensive than just the traditional school population studies. Ideally the data would look at future growth or decline in population; changing demographics by age, race, etc., Looking to develop and use the data on a community-wide basis to help plan for changing demands for service including but not limited to education, parks & recreation, public safety, transportation, etc.
Thanks,
Bob Kiely
City Manager
Lake Forest, IL
title: Community Population Projections and Studies
